title: A Bioconductor package for identifying novel Alternative PolyAdenylation Sites (PAS) from RNA-seq data
abstract: Alternative polyadenylation (APA) is one of the important post- transcriptional regulation mechanisms which occurs in most human genes. InPAS facilitates the discovery of novel APA sites and the differential usage of APA sites from RNA-Seq data. It leverages cleanUpdTSeq to fine tune identified APA sites by removing false sites.
